intro: Cyphostemma ankaranense, commonly known as the Madagascar moonvine, is a climbing plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant is characterized by its slender, twining stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow, and it produces small, orange fruits that are edible. Cyphostemma ankaranense is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
